snippet: Solo had faced two counts of fourth-degree misdemeanor assault after what was described in court papers as an alcohol-fueled scuffle with her half-sister and her teenage nephew last June.
abstract: Judge dismisses misdemeanor assault charges against United States women's national soccer team goalkeeper Hope Solo, likely clearing way for her to play in the Women's World Cup; Solo had been charged after alcohol-fueled scuffle with her half-sister and teenage nephew.
lead_paragraph: Solo had faced two counts of fourth-degree misdemeanor assault after what was described in court papers as an alcohol-fueled scuffle with her half-sister and her teenage nephew last June.

headline.main: Judge Dismisses Assault Charges Against U.S. Goalie Hope Solo
headline.print_headline: U.S. Goalie Has Charges Against Her Dismissed
